A '''sorcerous duel''' often occurred between two [[Sorcerer (kit)|sorcerers]] who were unable to resolve their differences peacefully. These duels were respected and honored throughout the [[Zakhara|Land of Fate]].

All sorcerers in [[Zakhara]] abided by the rules of the sorcerous duel or faced harsh consequences from their superiors.

Rules of Conduct.Attack Mode: This action directly assaulted the opponent, draining energy from their defensive pool if successful.
Rules of Conduct.Defense Mode: Defensive actions limited, or completely negated, an attack action depending on how much defensive energy was used.
Rules of Conduct.Drain Mode: By draining their opponent, a sorcerer was able to siphon energy from only one of their opponent's energy pools. The victim of the drain might not even be aware that their magical energy had just been depleted.
Rules of Conduct.Fortify Mode: Fortifying protected against drain attacks according to how much energy was expended into the fortification.

document_data.The End:
A sorcerer usually accepted defeat once their magical energy was completely depleted since they had no defense against their opponent's actions. 

The winner of a sorcerous duel named the penalty of the loser. Generally speaking, the severity of the penalty was determined by the nature of the disagreement between the two sorcerers. Rematches for these duels never occurred.
